summary: E-commerce app specifically for the small town of Kodinar. The app will serve local buyers and sellers within the city.
architectural_notes: Target audience: residents and local businesses in Kodinar, a small town

existing_features.title: Build a product browsing page that displays all available Kodinar listings in a grid layout with product image, name, price, category badge, and an 'Add to Cart' button. Include a category filter sidebar and a search bar to filter products by name or keyword.
Build a product detail page showing full product info (name, description, price, stock, seller name), a quantity selector, and an 'Add to Cart' / 'Buy Now' button.

Implement a shopping cart accessible from a persistent cart icon in the header. The cart should list selected items, allow quantity updates and removal, show a subtotal, and include a 'Place Order' button that submits the order to the backend.

Create a Seller Dashboard page (accessible after registering as a seller) where sellers can add new product listings, view their existing listings, edit product details, and mark items as out of stock.
Add a user registration and profile page where visitors can sign up as a buyer or seller by providing name and contact info. Display current user role and name in the header once registered.

Apply a warm, vibrant visual theme inspired by a small Indian town marketplace â€” using earthy saffron, turmeric yellow, and deep terracotta as the primary palette, with clean white cards and a bold serif-influenced heading font. The design should feel lively and locally rooted, with a prominent 'Kodinar Bazaar' brand in the header, culturally resonant iconography, and a layout that prioritizes product discovery.
Use generated static image assets for the homepage hero banner and app logo. Render them from frontend/public/assets/generated.

Add a Stripe Checkout / payment step to the order flow on the frontend. After the user clicks 'Place Order' on the CartPage, display a payment form (using Stripe Elements) to collect card details and process payment before confirming the order. Show clear success and failure states. On success, navigate to the existing OrderConfirmationPage.

new_feature_requests.summary: Local e-commerce platform for Kodinar city

Create a backend data model and actor supporting: product listings (name, description, price, category, image URL, seller info, stock quantity, city=Kodinar), user profiles (name, contact, role: buyer/seller), and orders (buyer, items, total, status, timestamp). Expose CRUD operations for products, user registration, and order placement.
Integrate Stripe payment processing so customers can pay for orders directly on the platform, enabling the platform to collect a share of each transaction as profit.

Add Stripe payment integration to the backend: store a Stripe payment intent ID and payment status (pending, paid, failed) on each order record. Expose a backend function to create a payment intent for a given order total and return the client secret, and another to confirm/update payment status after successful payment.
